Description: Shoulder sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery column-krater; interior glazed black; exterior: from top, black at junction of shoulder and neck (now lost); below, frieze of alternating black and red tongues; below, black-figure male figure (top of head with red fillet, eye, ear and part of beard remaining) to left.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.182) (phase 3)
